title: Julius Erving
summary: Julius Winfield Erving II (born February 22, 1950), commonly known by the nickname Dr. J, is an American former professional basketball player. Regarded as one of the most influential basketball players of all time,[1][2][3] Erving helped legitimize the American Basketball Association (ABA)[4] and was the best-known player in that league when it merged into the National Basketball Association (NBA) after the 1975â€“76 season.
